entry.title: Altay railway station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that until the opening of Altay railway station (pictured) in June 2017, no railway services were provided to Altay City, a tourist attraction with rich mineral resources?

entry.title: Robert Ford Jr. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Robert Ford Jr. wrote the first article about hip-hop in a major publication?

entry.title: My Little Love (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Adele's song "My Little Love" features voice notes of her nine-year-old son?

entry.title: Dennis Law (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dennis Law broke an "unwritten commandment" while returning a punt, causing him to get tackled in the end zone?

entry.title: Congressional Workers Union (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during a call that led to the creation of the Congressional Workers Union, one of the participants attended from a bathroom stall?

entry.title: Eyuwan Soviet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 1950s, 70 percent of senior officers in the People's Liberation Army came from the Eyuwan Soviet area?

entry.title: Sacambaya River (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to legend, the Sacambaya River houses treasure hidden in a cavern by Jesuits?

entry.title: a statue of Ernest Rutherford (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a statue of Ernest Rutherford was snapped off by a thief and later found in an attic?
